com.penthera.virtuoso.net.security.client

Interface IKeyStore

  • public interface IKeyStore
    Interface to the key store for mutual SSL authentication.
    • Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      containsAlias 
      abstract boolean containsAlias(java.lang.String alias)
      Indicates whether the given alias is present in this KeyStore.
      boolean containsAlias(java.lang.String alias) throws java.security.KeyStoreException
      Indicates whether the given alias is present in this KeyStore.
      Parameters:
      alias - The alias for the entry.
      Returns:
      True if the alias exists, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.security.KeyStoreException - if KeyStore is not initialized.
      deleteEntry 
      abstract void deleteEntry(java.lang.String alias)
      Deletes the entry identified with the given alias from the KeyStore.
      void deleteEntry(java.lang.String alias) throws java.security.KeyStoreException, java.io.IOException
      Deletes the entry identified with the given alias from the KeyStore.
      Parameters:
      alias - The alias for the entry.
      Throws:
      java.security.KeyStoreException - if KeyStore is not initialized.
      java.io.IOException - If a problem occurs writing to the KeyStore.
      getCreationDate 
      abstract java.util.Date getCreationDate(java.lang.String alias)
      Returns the creation date of the entry with the given alias.
      java.util.Date getCreationDate(java.lang.String alias) throws java.security.KeyStoreException
      Returns the creation date of the entry with the given alias.
      Parameters:
      alias - The alias for the entry.
      Returns:
      The creation date, or null if the specified alias is not bound to an entry.
      Throws:
      java.security.KeyStoreException - if KeyStore is not initialized.
      getEntry 
      abstract java.security.KeyStore.Entry getEntry(java.lang.String alias)
      Entry for the given alias.
      java.security.KeyStore.Entry getEntry(java.lang.String alias) throws java.security.KeyStoreException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException
      Entry for the given alias.
      Parameters:
      alias - The alias for the entry.
      Returns:
      The Entry with the given alias, or null.
      Throws:
      java.security.KeyStoreException - if KeyStore is not initialized.
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the required algorithm is not available.
      java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException - if the entry can not be recovered.
      importPKCS12 
      abstract void importPKCS12(java.io.InputStream input, java.lang.String password)
      Imports a PKCS12 certificate into the application's KeyStore from the provided InputStream.
      void importPKCS12(java.io.InputStream input, java.lang.String password) throws java.security.cert.CertificateException, java.security.KeyStoreException, java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, java.io.IOException
      Imports a PKCS12 certificate into the application's KeyStore from the provided InputStream.
      Uses the supplied password to extract the PKCS12 data.
      Replaces an Entry in the KeyStore with the same alias.
      PKCS12 certificates can be bundled into an application as a raw resource. The raw resource can be read in and passed to this interface. 
       
 Virtuoso mVirtuoso = Virtuoso(getApplicationContext());
 IKeyStore vKeyStore = mVirtuoso.getKeyStore();
 
 // R.raw.client refers to client.p12 (a PKCS12 certificate) in the raw resource folder.
 InputStream is = getResources().openRawResource(R.raw.client);
 vKeyStore.importPKCS12(is,"MY_PASSWORD");
      The import is a blocking operation and should not be performed on the main UI thread.
      Parameters:
      input - The InputStream to load this PKCS12's data from.
      password - The password to extract the PKCS12, maybe null.
      Throws:
      java.security.cert.CertificateException - if an exception occurred while loading the certificates.
      java.security.KeyStoreException - if an error occurred during creation of the KeyStore.
      java.security.UnrecoverableKeyException - if a key can not be recovered.
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the required algorithm is not available.
      java.io.IOException - if a problem occurred while reading from the stream.
